Food & Culinary Arts.name: Spice Rack Showdown
Food & Culinary Arts.description: Test your knowledge of herbs, spices, and kosher dietary laws! This quiz explores the nuances of flavor and tradition in the culinary world.

questions.text: Which of these is not a spice?
Which of these foods is not traditionally considered kosher?
Which of these is not a type of chili pepper?

Food & Culinary Arts.name: Global Gastronomy
Food & Culinary Arts.description: From citrus hybrids to international delicacies, this quiz takes you on a flavorful journey around the globe.  Are you a true connoisseur of diverse cuisines?

questions.text: What is the name of the fruit that is half tangerine and half grapefruit?
Which of these is not an ingredient in Yorkshire pudding?
Which of these foods is poisonous to dogs?
In what restaurant can you order a Grand Slam breakfast?
In America, what is the main ingredient in pepperoni?
Which of these is not a traditional Greek dish?
What is the principal ingredient in traditional cole slaw?
Cheese is a necessary ingredient in which of these dishes?

Food & Culinary Arts.name: Bready & Beyond
Food & Culinary Arts.description: From flatbreads to breakfast cereals, this quiz dives into the world of baked goods and unique food preparations.  Can you identify these culinary creations?

questions.text: A pita is a type of what?
Which of the following breakfast cereals is shaped like the letter O?
Which of these dishes is made from pig intestines?

Food & Culinary Arts.name: Breakfast Bonanza
Food & Culinary Arts.description: Sausage-wrapped pancakes? Opium-laced poppy seeds? This quiz explores the quirky and surprising side of breakfast traditions worldwide.

questions.text: What's the popular name of the breakfast meal consisting of sausages wrapped in pancakes?
Which of these foods could contain small amounts of naturally occurring opium?
What tea is known for its distinctive bergamot flavor?

Food & Culinary Arts.name: Sweet & Savory Secrets
Food & Culinary Arts.description: From candies to legumes, this quiz explores the diverse ingredients and flavors that make up our favorite foods.  Do you know your cacao from your cat food?

questions.text: Which of the following candies is traditionally fruit flavored?
Which of these are not legumes?
In cooking, the term 'au gratin' is sometimes used to describe a dish with what topping?
The term 'chili con carne' refers to chili with what?
Which of these foods could you catch at sea?
Which of these is made from cacao seeds?
If you ask for 'gai' at a Thai restaurant, what will you get?
Which of these is not found in a Snickers candy bar?

Food & Culinary Arts.name: British Bites & Beyond
Food & Culinary Arts.description: From bangers and mash to 'Where's the beef?', this quiz explores iconic British dishes and advertising slogans.  Are you ready to tackle this culinary challenge?

questions.text: The British dish 'bangers and mash' is made up of sausage and what?

What term is used to describe a group of fish?
A knish is traditionally stuffed with what filling?
What is an alternate name for the food dish 'Beijing duck'?

Food & Culinary Arts.name: Cocktail Creations & Culinary Curiosities
Food & Culinary Arts.description: From Pink Ladies to cat food endorsements, this quiz delves into the unexpected corners of the culinary world.  Prepare for some surprising facts!
